e4: Maintaining the current policy, though seemingly successful, is ethically questionable.  The new policy, while risking short-term market fluctuations, promotes transparency and long-term trust with investors.  Addressing the potential for misinformation through clear communication is crucial. Ultimately, ethical practices should take priority over short-term gains.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It presents a fair and unbiased view of the company's financial performance, avoiding any intentional manipulation or obfuscation.  It considers all stakeholders, ensuring information is readily understandable and accessible to all investors, not just sophisticated ones.  Consistency and adherence to accounting standards are vital.  Finally, clear communication around any changes to reporting methods is critical to build trust and avoid misunderstanding.
e6: I would ask about the specifics of their proposed communication plan to mitigate the potential negative short-term market reaction to the new policy. I'd also want to understand their assessment of the risks associated with different investor groups misunderstanding the shift and how they will monitor the impact on retail investors. Finally, I'd inquire about a timeline for implementing the changes and a plan for continuous monitoring and evaluation of its effectiveness.
